message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.PL, cs.AR 

This paper deals with a security issue in cyber-physical systems (CPS), which involves both software and hardware components. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also proposes a new mitigation technique that involves manipulating the compiler-generated control flow graph, which falls under the category of cs.PL (Programming Languages). Additionally, the paper evaluates the effectiveness and efficiency of the proposed technique on a realistic CPS testbed, which falls under the category of cs.SE (Software Engineering) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper also mentions the use of formal methods to verify the correctness of the proposed technique, which falls under the category of cs.AR (Hardware Architecture).
